name: Hotel des Trois Couronnes

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel with my mother 8th - 13th June 07 for her 60th birthday and it would be impossible to fault the place.
reviews.title: Breathtaking in every way! Totally amazing!

likes.liked: — EVERYTHING! The sheer luxury, panoramic views of Alps and Lake, central location.

reviews.text: I was determined that it should be special so booked a Lake View room, which was well worth the extra money. What better sight is there than waking up in the morning and seeing the Alps? We were on the 3rd floor and had 2 balconies - 1 from the bedroom (I booked a twin room) and 1 from the bathroom. Our balconies were well-used throughout our stay - We sat in our robes (which were provided) on the balcony before going for breakfast each morning and we sat there late into the night with a glass of wine. The views were amazing and it was so peaceful.
reviews.title: Excellence in Vevey

reviews.text: Transfers to and from the hotel are very expensive, so I'd recommend getting the train which is direct from Geneva Airport to Vevey, and then getting a taxi the other end. The trains are very regular (approx every 20mins), go from platform 3 and only take about an hour. And it's pretty cheap and couldn't be easier.
reviews.title: Absolutely Wonderful

reviews.text: Upon arrival at the hotel (which I booked through the Five Star Alliance website) we were given a complimentary glass of champagne and our cases were taken up to our room. There were jellied sweets and a bowl of cherries (which seem to be everywhere!!) in the room with complimentary bottles of spring water. (On our last night we were also given a complimentary fruit bowl and had we have eaten all the fruit we would not have needed any dinner for 2 days!) There were nice touches such as chocolate truffles left for us every evening and the spring water was replenished each morning, as were the gorgeous Molton Brown products in the bathroom. Slippers were changed on alternate days. The room was serviced twice a day.
reviews.title: Beautiful, comfortable hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The mini bar was well stocked, but expensive as one would expect, so I would recommend buying things from the local Co-op supermarket (which is very cheap) and keeping them in the fridge if you are likely to be thirsty!
reviews.title: Room with a beautiful view!
Good and bad in Vevey
reviews.text: I don't want to write a review, since we didn't stay there, but I'd just like to correct a note in a previous review. Someone stated it was suitable for the disabled, but I was in a wheelchair when we visited, and I couldn't believe that a prestigious hotel didn't have a lift from the ground floor entrance up to the reception desk.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were seen approaching, and guided to the rather shabby service lift, then led through the kitchens, and finally to the entrance hall. On leaving, I queried as to whether there really wasn't a lift, and told no, since it was an old building it would be difficult to install.... Amazing.
reviews.title: SO Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Incidentally, we were thrilled to find a B & B in the most central position you could wish for. In the old town, about one minute from the main square; bedroom not very spacious, but use of well-appointed bathroom and kitchen, plus sitting room with balcony. On the third floor with lift, overlooking the lake, which I never grew tired of looking at. Helpful landlady with perfect English. Mme. Paulette Reber, 43 rue du Lac, Vevey.
reviews.title: The Pearl of Veveyl

reviews.text: This is a truly amazing hotel in an absolutely beautiful location. This was the most expensive hotel we stayed in during our trip, but it lived up to every expectation. The location on Lake Geneva is ideal, and the hotel makes the most of this with an outside terrace on the second floor with a fantastic restaurant as well as a sun deck. There is also a spa and an indoor pool just under the deck. The rooms were beautifully decorated with modern bathrooms. I would love to give this hotel 10 stars, but could not honestly give it the 5 star rating, because we were extremely surprised and disappointed to find out on our arrival that the hotel is not air conditioned. Every night we looked out at the beautiful view over the lake as we struggled to sleep in the hot and humid room. Despite this one (admittedly large) problem, this is an amazing hotel and I would go back to it and recommend it to other travelers - but not in July!
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Trois Couronnes in Vevey for 5 nights in a standard room.On arrival we were taken to a room on the first floor overlooking the main entrance i.e. not with a lake view.We knew we had not paid for such a view but were upset to find that our room was so close to a busy road. We had not expected this as the hotel website made no mention of the noise that was to be endured by guests in these rooms.A trolley bus passed by every few minutes, cars with screeching horns and a clock tower with bells that chimed ALL through the night. On top of this the room was insufferably hot - the hotel has no air conditioning. There were no shutters and the windows had to be kept open to get any air. After half an hour in this room I had had enough! I went to reception and enquired about the possibility of a quieter room.We were told we could change rooms the following day and were offered one of the hotel's portable air conditioning units to make the room temperature more tolerable. This did help quite a lot. NOTE: these units are not advertised so now you know!! This first bedroom was large and well equipped with a good bathroom - plenty of Molton Brown toiletries etc. The folowing day we moved to our quieter room. This had a side lake view and small balcony which was nice. It was quieter too but sadly we lost the air con unit - didn't feel I could ask for any thing else so we put up with the heat for the next 4 nights.Cold wet flannels got us through the night - not really what you expect from a 5* hotel. This second bedroom had a much inferior bathroom with old looking brown tiles and the narrowest bath I have ever come across in the world. Kate Moss may fit in it but we didn't !! There was a detachable shower head on the wall but no shower guard or even a curtain. The floor got wet even being very careful.Most definitely not a 5 * bathroom. The rest of the hotel was lovely - nice terrace and indoor sitting areas.We were offered fresh orange or fizz when we arrived which was nice. The restaurant was excellent for breakfast and an interesting experience in the evening.An evening meal typically took around 2 hours. On holiday you are not in a rush but this was too much .One evening we were still eating in pitch dark with 2 small candles - it was light when we arrived.Very French menu and ambiance ( frogs legs, rabbit terrine and veal sweetbreads as starters.) All beautifully presented. Vevey is lovely and a great base for rail and boat trips. We would only recommend this hotel if you are rich enough to afford one of the lake view rooms and don't mind heat at night. Incidentally neither of us thought that this hotel was anywhere near as good as the next hotel we stayed in at Zermatt. Bit miffed that we had informed the hotel that it was our wedding anniversary- had hoped for something - bottle of wine in room maybe. Sadly it got no mention.
reviews.title: Lovely lakeside position

likes.liked: — excellent breakfast dining area and the situation in Vevey
likes.disliked: — lack of air con, poor bathroom

reviews.text: This was a nice hotel. The greeting that we received from the manager was wonderful. The welcome bottle of wine and appetizers was a nice treat. The front desk staff was GREAT. Our room had two full bathrooms. I have travelled extensively and have never seen that. The food at the hotel was good. The restaurant service was a bit uneven at dinner. We gave up waiting for our breakfast eggs after 30 minutes so we could catch our train. Most of the restaurant staff was friendly. The lake views were great. Vevey is a great town.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

likes.liked: — The front desk staff and the views.

description: Since 1842, the Hotel des Trois Couronnes is located on the shores of Lake Geneva, facing the stunning Swiss Alps. Spacious but intimate, all 71 rooms, Junior Suites and Suites match with today's tastes, combining luxury, refinement and modernity. Epicureans will enjoy "Le Restaurant" with its grand panoramic terrace serving traditional cuisine cooked either in a light or in a gourmet way and offering every season a new menu. A wide range of dishes are without lactose and/or gluten and we propose as well vegetarian's menu.The Puressens Destination Spa is welcoming both hotel guests and day clients looking for personal treatment packages extending over a period of several days around a concept of well-being based on three pillars: “Body, Spirit and Nutrition”. The Puressens Destination Spa offers each client a specific treatment package adapted to their needs and expectations. These treatments will be accompanied by delicious menus based on light and balanced nutrition prepared by the head chef in consultation with a dietician. The Puressens Destination Spa works with a collection of doctors and specialists who concentrate on anti-aging, nutrition, sports, and preventive health programs, including smoking cessation, supervised detoxification, stress management, and weight loss. The 1500-square-meter spa provides a broad range of skin-care, beauty, wellness, and sports treatments in the 10 treatment rooms. The spa also features indoor and outdoor relaxation areas,spa cuisine, a sauna, steam room, and separate men's and women's changing areas with showers. The spa's signature treatment is the Joëlle Ciocco Discovery Treatment. It includes an analysis of the guest's skin type and identification of external aggressions on the skin and ends with an adaptation of personal skin treatment.
